Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Josephine H
Reviews.Content: Excellent food at breakfast. Clean and simple but luxurious rooms and decor. Free shuttle bus service collection from the airport prompt and invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_Pedro_F
Reviews.Content: The free shuttle takes you to the subway in 10 minutes. This hotel has a excellent relation quality/price. It is hard to find a better deal in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: CarolNburgh
Reviews.Content: We were worried when one room smelled smoky, another had no heat and the third (where we stayed) had a broken towel rack. But there was much on the good side, too. The beds were firm. Breakfast included eggs, ham, cheeses, fruit, pastries and cappuccino. Each motel-style room had a small, private covered outdoor sitting area enclosed by hedges -- not exactly a "garden" but still a nice touch. Although the shuttle to the subway was not frequent, it did arrive right on schedule. Computer cable in the room had a fee, but WiFi in the lobby was free. In the end, we were pleased. Oh, and there's a pizza place just down the road (take a left on Campanelle) that was full of locals and good flavors and prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Ciampiano airport”
Reviews.Author: AnuKatriina
Reviews.Content: Easy access from the airport and the free shuttle service works nice. Clean rooms, breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is not so well!”
Reviews.Author: tea_peco
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is not so well. There is too much sweet things instead of boiled eggs... chicken ham or more cheese. The shuttle service is very nice, but it may be more often, and the last pick up from Cinicetti should be later than 21:50h especially in the weekend. For the rest if you are not such a good sleeper, than choose another hotel, cause the plains will wake you up for sure very early. The room is clean every day, the beds are okay to sleep on it. Pasta in the hotel restaurant is more than worth to try it, delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: borimir
Reviews.Content: We loved our room, we loved our kitchen, we loved our garden, we loved the hotel shuttle ... A nice hotel, probably even nicer in the hot summer days. A perfect place to relax after the whole day walking around Rome. I don't think that going to Rome by car will be more convenient than using the shuttle and metro - 1/2h to city center. Very helpful staff, especially the shuttle driver. Rich, fresh and tasty breakfast. What else one needs for a week stay in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Outside the City”
Reviews.Author: Jon G
Reviews.Content: We loved it. A great place to stay if you have a car, because driving in the city for tourists is terrible, and parking at this Hotel was great. Train station and regular shuttles probably make this a fine choice if you don't have a car, too. The rooms are clean and we got a deluxe double which has quite a nice modern design style.

Reviews.Title: “See Rome from a distance”
Reviews.Author: david o
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with lovely rooms in a quiet garden complex, apart from during the day when aircraft are landing close by, but this stops in the evening. An ideal place to explore Rome without staying in the very busy city. Our plan was to leave early to Rome by Metro and return in time to pick up the shuttle and it worked fine, seven or eight hours walking Rome is plenty. There is a free courtesy bus to and from the metro then an easy 20 minute ride to the Spanish steps. The staff spoke English and could not be more helpful. Breakfast was spectacular with everything you could imagine including lovely bacon and eggs! A must venue for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “OK airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulhempstock
Reviews.Content: No reason to stay here unless you have an early flight out of Ciampino. Transfers to and from the airport were good, but transfers to the metro station are too infrequent and it's a long, hot walk. In fact it is a long walk to anything outside the hotel grounds. Sound proofing was good in the motel-style rooms so the noise from aircraft is not a problem. They call the strip of patio outside your door a "private garden" which is a bit of a stretch. Breakfast was reasonable. There is no Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel outside Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anega
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with my partner and 8 months baby for one night. Hotel is outside the city but we had own car and there was even shuttle service to the metro or train station. Hotel is nicely decorating in beautiful surroundings. Has a nice swimming pool, good breakfast. Can be a little bit noisy from landing aircrafts - just 10 mins from Ciampino airport. The rooms are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “City hotel just outside the city”
Reviews.Author: SusanNL
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we landed at Rome Ciampino airport and wanted one night in Rome before setting of for a trip around Tuscany. It is ideally situated to the airport with a shuttle service, has a lovely swimming pool and a small restaurant, ideal for one nights stay. The hotel staff were friendly and although they didn't speak too much English they really tried and were friendly and courteous. The rooms are of a high standard and nicely furnished. We got an excellent rate for the hotel through booking.com and for a hotel so close to Rome it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with horses around and airplanes above head”
Reviews.Author: Andron165
Reviews.Content: First time travelling to Rome we were amazed of hotel located only 10 minutes driving from airport Ciampino. Great shuttle service can bring You from airport to hotel and back, and from hotel to nearest metro station...free of charge. Surroundings around hotel make You think about horses,they are everywhere. Hotel located by the way to airport...airplanes flying above Your head... surprising was the only first time, especially then You swimming in outdoor pool...You just can read serial number of planes. About 20 walking to pizzeria, and supermarkets. Breakfast good, everyday great cakes. By evenings You can seat near Your number...drinking Italian wine or eating something (each number has separate place with chairs and table).AMAZING:)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: Branko29
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Piccolo Borgo near airport Ciampino for 2 days. Hotel has elegant surroundings, super swiming pool, tasty food and very friendly staff. Very good is free shuttle to and from Airport, railway and metro station. We would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: amidalka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Piccolo Borgo with my two girlfriend for two nights. The place was nice, quite far away from the metro station - we were dependent on the hotel`s shuttle bus which run as per the timetable; getting back to the hotel in the evening was a little bit more difficult as the shuttle bus (which was just a normal car for 4-6people) run every hour or so. Walking distance to the closest metro station was at least half an hour or even more. We liked the place, the room was nice even though the walls were covered with a little bit of mould; But the staff there - especially the room service and the admin person behind the reception counter - not friendly or nice at ALL!!! Very disappointed! One of the staff there, young guy who was working there and doing almost everything from driving the shuttle bus, working as a waitress or as a maintenance around the pool was VERY nice to us, helpful and kind. The rest of the stuff should change their attitude!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bronxite
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place. Very clean, comfortable rooms and surroundings. The staff was for the most part very helpful, and polite. They offer a shuttle to the train station and local shopping mall which was very convenient. Restaurant on site was very good and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend a stay there and go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ilanto
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times mainly in winter on business as it's very convenient for companies located in the area and for Ciampino airport. I probably haven't seen the hotel at its best (it feels more like a "summer" type of place, with a swimming pool and deck chairs in a semi-rural setting), but the experience has been a positive one. The rooms are clean, the breakfast buffet is good, staff are always polite and helpful. They have a free shuttle to take you to the metro station or to the nearby companies, or to their associated restaurant nearby, for most of the day. Not ideal if you want to experience the capital's night life, as it takes around 30 mins by taxi (at night) from central Rome, and most taxi drivers try to take you the long way (adding around €10 to the bill). I would recommend it if you're on a driving holiday, or if you want to stay in a quieter place that will allow you to get into Rome only when you feel like it, and relax by the pool the rest of the time.

HotelInfo.Name: Piccolo Borgo
